channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: Schools safe for children and staff, says CMO
item.description: Sir Michael McBride says there is a "certainty of long-term harm to many children" from not attending school.

item.title: Covid-19: Rules ease on dining, dancing and live shows in NI
item.description: The hospitality industry is preparing for the removal of table service rules this evening.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records 64 more coronavirus-linked deaths
item.description: The figure is 11 more than the previous week and brings the statistic agency's total to 3,246.

item.title: Brexit: Sefcovic says both EU and UK must compromise on protocol
item.description: Maros Sefcovic hints the EU will bring forward new ideas to ease the movement of goods across the Irish Sea.

item.title: Covid-19: Pupils will not have to 'routinely self-isolate'
item.description: The Public Health Agency (PHA) will begin tracing close contacts in schools on Friday.

item.title: Rathlin Island: Project to protect seabirds from rats and ferrets
item.description: The RSPB says 25 species of birds on the island are at risk partly due to the invasive predators.

item.title: NI Protocol: DUP could quit from Stormont 'within weeks'
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson also says his party will now boycott most north-south ministerial meetings.

item.title: Queen's offers students £1,500 not to take up university accommodation
item.description: The university says it is taking the action due to "unprecedented" demand for rooms in its halls.

item.title: Brexit: Maros Sefcovic urges politicians to 'dial down' NI Protocol rhetoric
item.description: European Commission vice president Maros Sefcovic calls for calm as he visits Northern Ireland.

item.title: Click Energy set to up electricity prices by 16%
item.description: The average bill for those on a variable rate tariff is expected to go up by about £100 a year.

item.title: Mid and East Antrim Council to refer itself to public services ombudsman
item.description: The Mid and East Antrim decision relates to the withdrawal of port staff conducting Brexit checks.

item.title: North Belfast: Lorry set alight in attempted hijacking
item.description: The lorry driver was not injured in what police say was a "terrifying ordeal".

item.title: Covid-19 NI vaccine cert app 'built for overseas travel only'
item.description: Students fear they will miss out as vaccination proof will be needed for big events and nightclubs in GB.

item.title: Covid-19: PHA to take over contact tracing in schools from Friday
item.description: It is hoped the Public Health Agency's input will reduce the number of pupils who have to self-isolate.

item.title: Covid-19: Further push to vaccinate students in 'jabbathon'
item.description: Sixty walk-in clinics across 30 campuses will offer first jabs to university and college students.

item.title: Public Health Agency to take over contact tracing in schools
item.description: Principals' representatives and teaching unions are expected to be consulted on the plan later.

item.title: Covid-19: Northern Ireland health system 'one step from chaos'
item.description: BBC News NI is given exclusive access to an intensive care unit, where patients are battling Covid.

item.title: Covid-19: Table service rules over for NI pubs and restaurants
item.description: Up to 15 people are now allowed indoors in homes while dancing will be allowed at wedding receptions.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: 'I didn't even see a funeral'
item.description: Dr Mick Loftus, part of the last Mayo panel to lift Sam Maguire in 1951, says there is a lot of "hullabaloo" surrounding the supposed 'curse'

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Syrian refugees in NI 'trapped' in poverty and trauma
item.description: Healthcare access is described as "abysmal", while language barriers remained an ongoing problem.

item.title: Holy Cross dispute: The terror and the trauma recalled 20 years on
item.description: A teacher, priest and minister recall the dispute outside Holy Cross Primary School in Belfast in 2001.

item.title: QUB offers students £1,500 deal not to take up halls of residence
item.description: The university says due to "unprecedented" demand accommodation in its halls is oversubscribed.

item.title: 'A choice between the political institutions and Protocol' - DUP leader
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says a choice must be made between the political institutions and the NI Protocol.

item.title: Energy firm apologises for gas price hike
item.description: Firmus energy has announced gas tariffs in the Ten Towns Network area will increase by 35% from 1 October.

item.title: Holy Cross: 'I was in the school and we heard an explosion'
item.description: Two decades on from the Holy Cross dispute some of those present remember the tension and fear.

item.title: Philip O’Doherty: 'How I built a billion-pound company'
item.description: Philip O'Doherty founded E&I Engineering, which will be sold to a US firm in a deal worth $2bn (£1.45bn).

item.title: Sinn Féin selects Pádraig Delargy and Ciara Ferguson as new Foyle MLAs
item.description: They succeed Martina Anderson and Karen Mullan who stood down after a party restructure in Foyle.

item.title: Donegal engineering firm to be sold for £1.4bn
item.description: E&I Engineering, founded by Derry City chairman Philip O'Doherty, is being sold to a US-based company.

item.title: Rainbow crossing: NI's first rainbow crossing unveiled in Londonderry
item.description: It links the Guildhall to the Peace Bridge and aims to support the city's LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: County Kerry: Gardaí continues investigation into Ballyreahan deaths
item.description: The bodies of three members of the same family were found on Tuesday.

item.title: Leona Maguire: 'Incredible' homecoming for star Irish golfer
item.description: County Cavan turns out to welcome home Leona Maguire who helped Europe win the Solheim Cup.

item.title: County Kerry: Criminal investigation launched after three found dead
item.description: Gardaí (Irish police) say a firearm was discovered near to the body of one of the deceased.

item.title: Republic of Ireland 1-1 Serbia: Late own goal gives under-pressure Stephen Kenny his best result as manager
item.description: A late equaliser gives the Republic of Ireland their best result under Stephen Kenny as they draw with Serbia in World Cup qualifying.

item.title: Republic of Ireland to ban the sale of polluting solid fuels
item.description: The new rules, which will make Ireland a low-smoke zone, are expected to be in place within a year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Republic of Ireland eases gathering and wedding restrictions
item.description: Places of worship can operate at 50% capacity, while live music and dancing can resume at weddings.

item.title: HSE cyber-attack: Irish health service still recovering months after hack
item.description: Almost four months after a ransomware attack on the Irish health service, disruption remains.

item.title: World Cup qualifying: Late Duffy header saves Republic of Ireland from Azerbaijan defeat
item.description: Shane Duffy spares the Republic of Ireland's blushes with a late header to earn a World Cup qualifying draw with Azerbaijan in Dublin.

item.title: Irish Leaving Certificate grades up 2.4% on 2020
item.description: The increase is on top of a significant jump in results the year before.
